intro: Aporosa basilanensis, commonly known as the Philippine hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Its botanical features make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
